intro: Lupulina, commonly known as the honeycomb plant, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, honeycomb-like structures on its leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, adding visual interest to its appearance. Lupulina is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
